Dashboard Notifications
Do you know what Depression is? 
Depression is the world’s leading cause of disability. It is the most burning issue in the world. Depression is a complex clinical entity that can pose challenges for clinicians regarding both accurate diagnosis and effective timely treatment. Depression is a major cause of psychological illness in all over the world It is clear that depression affects not only the life of the person who suffers from the disorder, but also the lives of family and friends and depression ultimately affects society as a whole. Means it is effecting the whole peoples around the person who is facing this suffer 3.8% of the world’s population is affected by depression. About 25% of patients admitted to hospitals due to depression actually suffer from psychotic depression. Young adults aged 18-22 are the most likely age group to suffer from depression. 19.7% of people of UK aged 16 and over showed symptoms of anxiety or depression. Around 6.7% of American adults have experienced depression. Total economic burden brought about by depression is $210.5 billion. Approximately 35% of adults who experienced a major depressive episode didn’t receive treatment. India is the most depressed country. 
 Symptoms? 
> Depression mood 
> Loss of interest or pleasure in usual activities
> Significant changes in weight and appetite
> Insomnia or hypersomnia
> Psychomotor agitation or retardation 
> Increase fatigue and loss of energy 
> Feelings of self-reproach, worthlessness or inappropriate guilt 
> Slowed thinking or impaired concentration 
> Suicide attempts or suicidal ideation.
